traits.name: Extraversion
traits.description: Tendency to seek stimulation in the company of others and to be energetic, assertive, and talkative.

facets.name: Warmth
facets.description: Friendliness and affection toward others

facets.name: Gregariousness
facets.description: Preference for companionship and social stimulation

facets.name: Assertiveness
facets.description: Forcefulness of expression and willingness to take charge

facets.name: Activity
facets.description: Energy, fast tempo, and vigorous movement

facets.name: Excitement-Seeking
facets.description: Need for environmental stimulation

facets.name: Positive Emotions
facets.description: Tendency to experience positive emotions

traits.name: Agreeableness
traits.description: Tendency to be compassionate and cooperative rather than suspicious and antagonistic toward others.

facets.name: Trust
facets.description: Willingness to believe that others have good intentions

facets.name: Straightforwardness
facets.description: Frank, sincere, and ingenuous speech

facets.name: Altruism
facets.description: Active concern for others' welfare

facets.name: Compliance
facets.description: Willingness to defer to others and inhibit aggression

facets.name: Modesty
facets.description: Tendency to be humble and self-effacing

facets.name: Tender-Mindedness
facets.description: Concern for others and sensitivity to suffering

traits.name: Conscientiousness
traits.description: Tendency to be organized, responsible, and hardworking.

facets.name: Competence
facets.description: Sense of personal efficacy and capability

facets.name: Order
facets.description: Preference for organization and structure

facets.name: Dutifulness
facets.description: Emphasis on importance of fulfilling obligations

facets.name: Achievement Striving
facets.description: Need for personal achievement and sense of direction

facets.name: Self-Discipline
facets.description: Ability to persist with difficult or unpleasant tasks

facets.name: Deliberation
facets.description: Tendency to think carefully before acting

traits.name: Neuroticism
traits.description: Tendency to experience negative emotions such as anxiety, depression, and vulnerability.

facets.name: Anxiety
facets.description: Tendency to experience worry, fear, and uneasiness

facets.name: Angry Hostility
facets.description: Tendency to experience anger and frustration

facets.name: Depression
facets.description: Tendency to experience sadness and hopelessness

facets.name: Self-Consciousness
facets.description: Tendency to be embarrassed and uncomfortable around others

facets.name: Impulsiveness
facets.description: Tendency to act on urges and cravings

facets.name: Vulnerability
facets.description: Susceptibility to stress and pressure

traits.name: Openness
traits.description: Appreciation for art, emotion, adventure, unusual ideas, curiosity, and variety of experience.

facets.name: Fantasy
facets.description: Receptivity to the inner world of imagination

facets.name: Aesthetics
facets.description: Appreciation of beauty in art and nature

facets.name: Feelings
facets.description: Openness to inner emotional states

facets.name: Actions
facets.description: Willingness to try new activities and experiences

facets.name: Ideas
facets.description: Intellectual curiosity and openness to new ideas

facets.name: Values
facets.description: Readiness to reexamine own values and those of authority

metadata.notes: Based on Costa & McCrae NEO-PI-R model with enhanced facet definitions
